meanings.definition: A warning or alarm, especially a loud noise or bell.
meanings.sent1: The loud larum of the fire alarm woke everyone up.
meanings.sent2: The larum of the police siren alerted the neighborhood to danger.
meanings.sent3: The larum of the school bell signaled the end of recess.
meanings.sent4: The larum of the car horn startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent5: The larum of the tornado siren sent shivers down everyone's spine.

meanings.definition: To sound a warning or alarm.
meanings.sent1: She had to larum loudly to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The guard will larum if he sees any suspicious activity.
meanings.sent3: He decided to larum playfully by shouting 'intruder alert!'
meanings.sent4: The dog will larum by barking if someone approaches the house.
meanings.sent5: In case of danger, remember to larum for help by shouting for assistance.
